page.title: 12Shipwrecks around St. Levan
page.content: {The coast of Cornwall is dangerous to {all shipping,}even with today's electronic aids.{Once a ship strikes the granite rocks of the St. Levan cliffs{there is generally little that {can be done to prevent its total loss. In 1957 a fishing boat was smashed to matchwood over a half-hour period at Pednavounder, and that was on a sandy beach. One of the very few lucky ones, a yacht 'Esperancia' enroute from Brazil to Rotterdam, sailed into Porthgwarra Cove at night, sunk and was refloated. Other ships, lost on the coast of St. Levan this century include: Khyber 1905, St. Guenole, 1948, Vert Prairial 1957, Nararene 1957, Saba 1966. Since 1900 another seven have sunk on the Runnelstone, one mile off Porthgwarra. The 'City of Westminster' lost in 1923, reportedly knocked two two metres of this rock.
